page.title: 19FARMING IN THE UPWEY AREA
page.content: DORSET IS AN AGRICULTURAL COUNTY AND AS SUCH THE UPWEY AREA IS NO EXCEPTION. THE VAST MAJORITY OF THE BLOCK IS CONNECTED IN SOME WAY WITH FARMING,AS EITHER AGRICULTURAL LAND OR AS FARM BUILDINGS AND THE LIKE. THE MAIN FARMS IN THE AREA ARE: FRIAR WADDON,WINDSBATCH FARM,HEWISH FARM,BAYARD FARM,DOWN FARM AND LOWER BINCOMBE FARM. MOST OF THE FARMS OPERATE MIXED FARMING ALTHOUGH WINDSBATCH FARM IS ALMOST ENTIRELY DAIRY. THE MAIN TYPES OF CEREALS ARE GROWN ON ALL THE OTHER FARMS,INCLUDING WHEAT,BARLEY,OATS AND MAIZE.FODDER CROPS AND OTHERS SUCH AS OILSEED RAPE AND KALE CAN ALSO BE FOUND. IN THE SUMMER A PARTICULARLY GOOD IMPRESSION OF THE DOMINANCE OF FARMING WILL BE SEEN FROM THE RIDGEWAY.
